summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Bank USA, dated September 25, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed by the grand jury, with addresses listed in Boston, MA and New York, NY.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for UBS
events.description: The subpoena commands UBS Bank USA to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to UBS Bank USA as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b), and 371 (conspiracy).

locations: UBS Bank USA, 1000 Harbor Blvd 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
139A Charles St Apt 233, Boston, MA (address listed for Ghislaine Maxwell)
116A E 65th St, New York, NY (address listed for Ghislaine Maxwell)
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and entities including Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, and Max Hotel Services Corp from account inception to present.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. § 1591 (sex trafficking), indicating the grand jury is investigating sex trafficking offenses.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested UBS not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The requested records are extensive, covering signature cards, wire transfers, safe deposit records, credit card statements, loan applications, online banking information, and all correspondence related to the accounts.
The document shows the investigation was active and seeking financial evidence as of September 2019, prior to Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest in July 2020.
